intro: Garaya atroviridis, commonly known as the dark green garaya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apocynaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its dark green, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Garaya atroviridis is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
